page.title: 10Hampstead Garden Suburb
page.content: HGS was planned by Henrietta Barnett and designed by Unwin and Lytens.It was first owned by HENRY VIII,then by Eton College who sold it to HB Trust. HB believed that people should live in a place of trees,grass & greenery. She also disliked alcohol and so there was to be no pub but a tea-house. The tea-house proved very popular & she therefore had a clubhouse built for meetings,alas,during the SWW it was hit by a bomb & has not been rebuilt.The tea-house was then forced to close through lack of custom. Houses in HGS are built in Tudor style,with long sloping roofs & chimneys.The roofs are pointed & very varying window sizes. There are numerous hedges in the area but they cannot be replaced by fences,and doors in the area have to conform to a colour scheme.
